issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

comment.body:
That is what I was trying to do. And since I had problems getting it to work - I thought it would make sense to log something here. 

FYI it looks like the following config works with almost everything : 

```
# # config file version
apiVersion: 1

# # list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
deleteDatasources:

# # list of datasources to insert/update depending
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: password
  user: grafanareader
  database: dashboard
  basicAuth: false
  isDefault: true
  jsonData:
     sslmode: disable
  version: 1
  editable: true
``` 

I think it may have been the missing first line with the `apiVersion: 1`that has made a difference. 

The only thing that is not being set now is the password.

issue.title: Add api_url value to Azure OAuth2 documentation
issue.body: The field api_url is required but not documented

issue.title: [Bug] - Alerts from hidden panels are not working when using webhook notification channel
issue.body:
What Grafana version are you using?
Version 5.0.2

What datasource are you using?
influxdb

What OS are you running grafana on?
Amazon Linux AMI

Hi,
I've configured alert notification channel to send alerts to Opsgenie via webhook.
I'm using two notification channels in my alert configuration: Email & Opsgenie
When I collapse a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard an email regarding the alert is being sent to the designated email address but the Opsgenie integration via webhook is not working and the alert is not being opened in OpgGenie.

If I extend a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard, both email & OpsGenie notification channels are working fine.

commits.message:
dashboard: fix rendering link to panel in collapsed row

(cherry picked from commit 0e5b790b54bab1e5832ade3f4d455b291d9e3d12)

fix failed tests for dashboard view state

(cherry picked from commit 205714759e6368dadf1bc91ea36e108638c53523)

dashboard: fix phantomjs panel rendering in collapsed row

(cherry picked from commit 05ac7d8fca8af0556695517abeb3d72ea1e081ee)

snapshot: fix legend rendering bug

(cherry picked from commit a472d38fbf97dc721137ac7347c759e8e3f8db88)

alerting: bad default state for notifiers

when we made image upload optional we didnt
show the default value properly in the UI. Which
caused confusing. This commit apply the default
values to existing notifiers in the edit pages
and reverts back to using uploadimage=true as the
default value.

(cherry picked from commit d29563ff8e126325be103ee49df680d1926e6847)

alert: fixes broken link back to grafana

If Grafana was configured to use a subpath it
was included twice in the link from the
alert notification back to Grafana.

closes #11403

(cherry picked from commit 55967075316de3719c36bc8e176fc0e59b4b56e9)

dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards

This changes the logic for the alert validation in the extractor. Validation
is executed twice, once before attempting to save the alerts and once after
saving the dashboard while saving the alerts to the db. The first validation
will not require that the alert has a dashboard id which allows new dashboards
with alerts to be saved.

Fixes #11247

(cherry picked from commit 68833fa97807989ed34932ab040d6578fbcdfb66)

Merge pull request #11413 from grafana/cp-5.0.4

Cherry-picks for v5.0.4

issue.title: [Feature Request] Constant Variable Without Quotes for use in MySQL Query
issue.body:
Hi,
I am trying to make a dashboard more portable, so I want to include variables that a user can use to change the table that a MySQL query selects from. I tried using the constant and it inserted into the query with single quotes like: SELECT * FROM 'myTableName', which gives an error because the correct syntax is SELECT * FROM myTableName.

If there is already a way to do this, then I'm sorry for posting here, but I cannot find a way and I know that it would be appreciated if it could be added.

Thanks!

comment.body:
Hi @MikeDombo 
Can you please confirm if this feature went somewhere in v5.0?
We are having a similar use case of the same thing and it would be great to know the status of this.

Thanks in advance!
Jorge

comment.body:
@asthomasdk questions should be asked on the [community site](https://community.grafana.com/). Github issues are for feature request and bug reports.

For now, please make sure use a provisioning configuration as described in latest [documentation](http://docs.grafana.org/administration/provisioning/#datasources).

issue.title: Fix #10555 #6888 Backslash in Prometheus variables
issue.body:
Prior this commit, `C:\bar` was escaped `C:\\\bar`. Should be `C:\\\\bar`.

Signed-off-by: Julien Pivotto <roidelapluie@inuits.eu>

when we made image upload optional we didn't
show the default value properly in the UI. Which
caused confusing. This commit applies the default
values to existing notifiers in the edit pages
and reverts back to using uploadimage=true as the
default value.

issue.title: [Feature request] Alerting on Google Hangouts Chat
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
4.6.3
### What datasource are you using?
Prometheus
### What OS are you running grafana on?
Ubuntu
 
Hi,
I'm trying to set up an alert using webhooks to a Google Chat / Hangouts chat room. I used the [official Google Chat documentation](https://developers.google.com/hangouts/chat/how-tos/webhooks) on setting up webhooks.

However, in Grafana there is currently no Google Chat type available in the alerting type dropdown list. I've tried using "webhook", but can't get past a "Webhook response status 400 Bad Request" error message. 


I think this is the case because there is currently no way to specify a custom HTTP message required by the Google Chat webhook?

So my question would be: Has anyone successfully set up a Google Chat alert configuration and could tell me how he/she get it to work?

Thank you!

comment.body:
Hello everyone,
I implemented a Google Hangouts Chat notifier in my [pull request](https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/11410) using the official JSON message format (https://developers.google.com/hangouts/chat/reference/message-formats/).

A sample alert notification (without a graph screenshot) looks something like this:
![google_chat_grafana_alert](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3827255/38025225-dfcf4d0a-3287-11e8-95d7-b973844a6d7f.PNG)

issue.title: GetFullDashboardUrl returns wrong URL if root_path contains sub-path components
issue.body:
Hey,

I'm using grafana's alert feature with version 5.0.3.
Grafana is running behind an apache2 reverse-proxy and listens on localhost:3000.
Apache2 redirects requests of <domain>/grafana to localhost:3000.
Everything works fine, except the URLs to the Alert-Rule that are contained in the notification messages.

Relevant grafana.ini entries:
```
[server]
protocol = https
http_addr = 127.0.0.1
domain = www.example.com
root_url = %(protocol)s://%(domain)s/grafana
```

The notifications make use of the function ``GetFullDashboardUrl`` added in this commit:
992fd37010061e752b97799eddb2fbe26434c9e3

However, in the sub-path configuration mentioned above the following happens:
 - setting.AppUrl will be root_path (including the sub-path)
 - setting.AppSubUrl will be everything after the host entry, because it is set to the .Path property after parsing it into an URL structure using url.Parse(...). This seems to happen in setting.go:parseAppUrlAndSubUrl(...)

So, GetFullDashboardUrl(..) concatenates setting.AppUrl and the result of GetDashboardUrl.
GetDashboardUrl starts with setting.AppSubUrl.


In my case this leads to duplicated path components, namely '.../grafana/grafana/...', when the link to the alert rules dashboard is generated.

Cheers,
Andreas

commits.message:
dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards

This changes the logic for the alert validation in the extractor. Validation
is executed twice, once before attempting to save the alerts and once after
saving the dashboard while saving the alerts to the db. The first validation
will not require that the alert has a dashboard id which allows new dashboards
with alerts to be saved.

Fixes #11247

Merge pull request #11411 from grafana/11247-save-alerts

dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards

pull_request.title: dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards
pull_request.body:
This changes the logic for the alert validation in the extractor. Validation
is executed twice, once before attempting to save the alerts and once after
saving the dashboard while saving the alerts to the db. The first validation
will not require that the alert has a dashboard id which allows new dashboards
with alerts to be saved.

Fixes #11247
